question: 役場
sourceMnemonic: A <kanji>service</kanji> <kanji>location</kanji> is a place that people go when they're in need of a service. The best place for this is the <vocabulary>town hall</vocabulary>. Everyone goes to this one location to voice their complaints and in return their needs are serviced by the officials in the town hall.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This word uses the on'yomi reading for the first kanji and the kun'yomi reading for the second kanji. That's all you have to remember, though, because you've seen both of these readings before!
